intro: Diplarpea paleacea, commonly known as the paleaceae plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Diplarpea paleacea typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
